text: ان كل نفس لما عليها حافظ

translations.translation: That over each soul there is a guardian.
There is no living being but there is a protector over it.
There is no soul which is not guarded (by the two angels who record all of its deeds).
There is not a soul that does not have a guardian over it.
There is no human being but has a protector over him.
There is not a soul but over it is a keeper.
Over every soul there is a watcher.
No human soul but hath a guardian over it.
[for] no human being has been left unguarded.
No soul is there but hath over it a watcher.
there is a guard over every soul.
There is no soul but has a protector over it.
There is no human being but has a protector over him (or her) (i.e. angels incharge of each human being guarding him, writing his good and bad deeds, etc.)
For every soul there is a watcher.
There is no soul without a Protector over it.
There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.

[86:4] Over every soul there is a keeper (if read la-mā, then mā is extra, and in, is softened in place of the hardened form with its subject omitted, that is to say, innahu; the lām is [a particle] for separation; if read lammā, then in is for negation and lammā means illā, ‘except that’) — the watcher is an angel that keeps a record of its deeds, both the good and the evil.
(No human soul) no believing or disbelieving soul-this is why Allah swore-(but hath a guardian over it) who record its words and deeds until he drives it into the grave.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: وبالجملة: وحق هذين القسمين العظيمين { إِن كُلُّ نَفْسٍ } أي: ما كل نفس من النفوس الزكية والخبيثة { لَّمَّا } أي: إلاَّ { عَلَيْهَا حَافِظٌ } [الطارق: 4] من قِبَل الحق، يحفظ لها أقوالها وأفعالها وأحوالها، وحالاتها ومقاماتها؛ حتى لا يدفعها ويسلمها إلى المقادير التي حصل منها، وصدر على طبقها حتى جوزيت على مقتضاها
